intro: Gerrardanthus paniculatus, commonly known as the African firecracker, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking red and orange tubular flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, narrow leaves. Its inflorescence consists of paniculate clusters, which give it a bushy appearance. It is well adapted to arid conditions and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
